intro: Espeletia rositae var. macrocephala, commonly known as the Rosita's large-headed espeletia, is a plant native to the high-altitude regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of the Andean páramo ecosystem. Its flowers are typically pink to purple in color and bloom during the cooler months. This variety is notable for its large, showy heads, which make it a distinctive and visually striking species within the Espeletia genus.
